Highlighted Clause: If such audit reveals an under-reporting of page views by an amount which would put publisher in a higher fee tier, than publisher shall promptly (a) pay to licensor the difference between the amount paid and the fee tier in which the publisher should have been.
Plain Language Summary: If an audit finds that a publisher under-reported their page views, resulting in a lower fee, the publisher must pay the difference to match the fee tier that corresponds to the correct number of page views.

Highlighted Clause: Licensor shall have the right, during normal business hours, upon at least five (5) daysâ advance written notice to publisher and no more than twice annually, to audit, examine, inspect, review and make copies or take extracts from, all books and records of publisher relating to the tracking and reporting of page views.
Plain Language Summary: The licensor can audit the publisher's records related to page view tracking and reporting up to twice a year, as long as they give at least 5 days' written notice.

Highlighted Clause: This agreement shall commence on the effective date and shall continue for an initial term of twelve (12) months following the launch date (the âinitial termâ).
Plain Language Summary: The agreement starts on the effective date and initially lasts for 12 months from the launch date.

Highlighted Clause: This agreement shall terminate: (i) by a party thirty (30) business days after the other partyâs receipt of written notice that such party is in material breach of any of the terms or conditions set forth in this agreement, unless such party cures such breach within said thirty (30) business days period or (ii) upon written notice if the other party becomes insolvent, makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, files a voluntary petition of bankruptcy, suffers or permits the appointment of a receiver for its business or assets, becomes subject to any proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency law, whether domestic or foreign, or has wound up or liquidated its business voluntarily or otherwise, and same has not been discharged or terminated within ninety (90) days.
Plain Language Summary: The agreement may be terminated if one party materially breaches the agreement and doesn't fix the breach within 30 business days of being notified, or if one party faces insolvency or legal issues related to bankruptcy and such situations aren't resolved in 90 days.

Highlighted Clause: Licensor shall not be liable to publisher for any inoperability of the service or for any loss of information or other injury, damage or disruption of any kind.
Plain Language Summary: The licensor is not responsible for any damages or losses if the service is inoperable or if there is a loss of information for any reason.

Highlighted Clause: Each party may disclose confidential information of the other party pursuant to the order or requirement of a court, administrative agency, or other governmental body, provided that such party gives reasonable prior notice to the other party to contest such order or requirement.
Plain Language Summary: Each party can share the other's confidential information if required by law, but they must inform the other party first to allow them to challenge the requirement.

Highlighted Clause: Publisher shall be responsible for payment of all reasonable expenses (including reasonable attorneysâ fees and costs) incurred by licensor in collecting any overdue amounts.
Plain Language Summary: The publisher must cover all reasonable legal costs and expenses that the licensor incurs while trying to collect any late payments from the publisher.

Highlighted Clause: Publisher may integrate the service on any web sites owned, operated or controlled by publisher as set forth in the service order, each an âapplicable siteâ.
Plain Language Summary: The publisher is allowed to use the service on their own websites as detailed in the service order.
